sentiments:
Based on the text provided, the sentiment can be calculated as follows:

Positive aspects: 
- The emergency exit seat provided extra comfort and space.
- The upgraded meal was of good quality and well presented.
- The entertainment system was good.
- The Premium Economy advantages without the higher price.
- The return trip service was good until the connecting flight delay.

Negative aspects:
- Flight from Manchester to Heathrow was delayed by 2 hours.
- The waiting area was crowded.
- Lack of prebooked meal available on the way back, especially for those connecting from a long overnight flight.
- Long delay on the connecting flight from Manchester with little explanation and a rude attendant.

Overall, the positive aspects seem to outweigh the negative aspects in the text. Therefore, on a scale from 1 (very positive) to -1 (very negative), the sentiment score of this text would be approximately 0.6.

sentiments:
Based on the text provided, the sentiment of the text can be calculated as follows:

Positive sentiments:
- Well-handled process
- Staff and/or standby passengers given priority
- Compensation as per rule
- Able to make it onto a British Airways flight later in the day

Negative sentiments:
- Bumped from British Airways flight
- Lack of clarity at the airport
- Last-minute confirmation of offloading
- Poor process for transferring between airports
- Poor follow-up on the matter
- Refusal by British Airways to state whether staff or standby passengers were prioritized
- Issues with transferring between Gatwick and Heathrow airports
- Having to queue for a voucher and ticket
- Missing the transfer bus

Overall, considering both the positive and negative sentiments expressed in the text, the sentiment score would be approximately -0.6, leaning towards the negative end of the scale.

Based on the text provided, the sentiment can be calculated as follows:

Positive Aspects: 
- The plane was quite new and clean.
- Decent leg room in seats 1A and 1C.
- The inflight brunch was nice with salad and fruit.

Negative Aspects: 
- The British Airways lounge was described as crammed and lacking seating.
- Furniture and seats were old and in need of replacement.
- The lounge on the second floor was closed.
- The delay due to runway modification.
- Inflight service was described as strange with bored crew members.
- The aircraft was parked on the tarmac rather than using an airbridge.

Overall, the negative aspects seem to outweigh the positive aspects in the text. Therefore, the sentiment score for this text would be around -0.5.
